instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.P3V42_G3H: What is P3V42_G3H? P3V42_G3H is a typo of PP3V42_G3H.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b , quarter fan spin, charger light flickering
threads.message:
Hi, I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged board , flickering charger light (like pulsing) and fan spins every few seconds.

I check <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> area and pretty nice and clean .
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>- 12.6v, PP3V$@_G3H-3.4v. I replaced both battery and charger current sensing resistors, no change. then I repalced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> but still the same.

If anyone can help me to sort this greatly appriciate.

Thank you

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b , quarter fan spin, charger light flickering
threads.message:
If the charging light goes off there might be a short somewhere, check resistance to ground on S0 lines.

Is <SIGNAL>P3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> stable?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b , quarter fan spin, charger light flickering
threads.message: Hi smiba , thank you for your replay. Found short in S0 line and replace the shorted resister. all good works fine now. thank you for your tip. spot on.
